definition[0]: to press a part of someone’s skin very tightly between your finger and thumb, especially so that it hurts
example[0]: We have to stop her pinching her baby brother.
definition[1]: to steal something, especially something small or not very valuable
definition[2]: to press something between your finger and thumb
example[3]: Pinch the edges of the pastry together to seal it.
definition[3]: if something you are wearing pinches you, it presses painfully on part of your body, because it is too tight
explanation[0]: Pinch is usually passive in this meaning
definition[5]: when you press someone’s skin between your finger and thumb
example[5]: She gave him a playful pinch.
